### 1. Introduction  
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is reshaping the landscape of modern medicine. According to the Wikipedia entry on *Artificial intelligence in healthcare* (source: Wikipedia), AI in this domain “is the application of artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze and understand complex medical and healthcare data. In some cases, it can exceed or augment human capabilities by providing better or faster ways to diagnose, treat, or prevent disease.”  

The five arXiv papers summarized below build on this foundational definition by exploring concrete implementations, emerging paradigms, and the attendant risks that accompany the diffusion of AI throughout clinical and operational workflows. ### 2. AI in Healthcare – Scope and Core Capabilities  

| Domain | Typical AI Tasks | Key Advantages |
|--------|------------------|----------------|
| **Diagnosis** | Image segmentation, pattern recognition in imaging, signal analysis in ECG/EKG | Faster, more accurate detection of subtle pathologies |
